American football Wikipedia American football From Wikipedia free encyclopedia Jump navigation Jump search This article about American variation gridiron football other uses see American football disambiguation Team field sport American football Larry Fitzgerald in blue catches pass while Cortland Finnegan in red plays defense at Pro Bowl Highest governing body International Federation American Football Nicknames Football gridiron First played November New Brunswick New Jersey United States Princeton vs Rutgers Characteristics Contact Full contact Team members both teams may freely substitute players between downs Type Team sport ball game Equipment Football Football helmet Pads shoulder knee Venue Football field rectangular yards long yards wide Glossary Glossary American football Presence Country region Worldwide Olympic No demonstrated at Summer Olympics World Games Yes invitational sport at Games American football referred as football in United States Canada also known as gridiron nb team sport played by two teams eleven players on rectangular field with goalposts at each end offense team with possession oval shaped football attempts advance down field by running with ball passing it while defense team without possession ball aims stop offense s advance take control ball themselves offense must advance at least ten yards in four downs plays if they fail they turn over football defense but if they succeed they are given new set four downs continue drive Points are scored primarily by advancing ball into opposing team s end zone touchdown kicking ball through opponent s goalposts field goal team with most points at end game wins American football evolved in United States originating from sports soccer rugby first American football match was played on November between two college teams Rutgers Princeton using rules based on rules soccer at time set rule changes drawn up from onward by Walter Camp Father American Football established snap line scrimmage eleven player teams concept downs Later rule changes legalized forward pass created neutral zone specified size shape football sport closely related Canadian football which evolved in parallel with at same time as American game although rules were developed independently from that Camp s Most features that distinguish American football from rugby soccer are also present in Canadian football two sports are considered primary variants gridiron football American football most popular sport in United States most popular forms game are professional college football with other major levels being high school youth football As update nearly million high school athletes college athletes play sport in United States annually National Football League most popular American football league has highest average attendance any professional sports league in world Its championship game Super Bowl ranks among most watched club sporting events in world league has an annual revenue around US billion Other leagues exist worldwide but sport does not have international popularity other American sports like baseball basketball Contents Etymology names History Early history Evolution game Professional era Teams positions Offensive unit Defensive unit Special teams unit Rules Scoring Field equipment Duration time stoppages Advancing ball downs Kicking Officials fouls Safety brain health Leagues tournaments Rival professional leagues International play Popularity cultural impact United States Other countries Variations related sports See also Notes Footnotes References Further reading External links Etymology names edit Main article Football word In United States American football referred as football term football was officially established in rulebook college football season sport first shifted from soccer style rules rugby style rules Although it could easily have been called rugby at this point Harvard one primary proponents rugby style game compromised did not request name sport be changed rugby terms gridiron American football are favored in English speaking countries other types football are popular such as United Kingdom Ireland New Zealand Australia History edit Main article History American football Part American football series on History American football Origins American football Early history First game Walter Camp First pro player First pro league Modern history Close relations other codes Medieval Old division Rugby Soccer Canadian Topics Black players in professional football Homosexuality Concussions Rugby union comparison Rugby league comparison Canadian football comparison Pro Football Hall Fame College Football Hall Fame Years NFL seasons College football seasons Glossary American football Portal v t e Early history edit American football evolved from sports soccer rugby Rugby like American football sport two competing teams vie control ball which can be kicked through set goalposts run into opponent s goal area score points considered be first American football game was played on November between Rutgers Princeton two college teams They consisted players each used round ball that could not be picked up carried It could however be kicked batted with feet hands head sides with objective being advance it into opponent s goal Rutgers won game Collegiate play continued several years with matches played using rules host school Representatives Yale Columbia Princeton Rutgers met on October create standard set rules use by all schools Teams were set at players each fields by feet m m were specified Harvard abstained from conference as they favored rugby style game that allowed running with ball After playing McGill University using both Canadian American rules Harvard players preferred Canadian style having only men on field running ball without having be chased by an opponent forward pass tackling using an oblong instead round ball An Harvard Yale game played under rugby style rules was observed by two Princeton athletes were impressed by it They introduced sport Princeton feat Professional Football Researchers Association compared selling refrigerators Eskimos Princeton Harvard Yale Columbia then agreed intercollegiate play using form rugby union rules with modified scoring system These schools formed Intercollegiate Football Association although Yale did not join until Yale player Walter Camp now regarded as Father American Football secured rule changes in that reduced size each team from players instituted snap replace chaotic inconsistent scrum Evolution game edit photograph Walter Camp Father American Football taken in Camp was captain Yale s football team introduction snap resulted in an unexpected consequence Prior snap strategy had been punt if scrum resulted in bad field position However group Princeton players realized that as snap was uncontested they could now hold ball indefinitely prevent opponent from scoring In in game between Yale Princeton both teams used this strategy maintain undefeated records Each team held ball gaining no ground an entire half resulting in tie This block game proved extremely unpopular with both teams spectators fans rule change was necessary prevent this strategy from taking hold reversion scrum was considered However Camp successfully proposed rule in that limited each team three downs tackles advance ball yards m Failure advance ball required distance within those three downs would result in control ball being forfeited other team This change effectively made American football separate sport from rugby resulting five yard lines added field measure distances made it resemble gridiron in appearance Other major rule changes included reduction field size by yards m m adoption scoring system that awarded four points touchdown two safety goal following touchdown five goal from field Additionally tackling below waist was legalized static line scrimmage was instituted cartoon by W C Morris highlighting dangers that were associated with sport Despite these new rules football remained violent sport Dangerous mass formations like flying wedge resulted in serious injuries deaths peak fatalities nationwide resulted in threat by President Theodore Roosevelt abolish game unless major changes were made In response colleges universities met in New York City discuss rule changes on December These proceedings resulted in formation Intercollegiate Athletic Association United States later renamed National Collegiate Athletic Association NCAA legal forward pass was introduced in although its impact was initially minimal due restrictions placed on its use idea yard wider field was opposed by Harvard due size new Harvard Stadium Other rule changes introduced that year included reduction playing time from minutes an increase distance required first down from yards m reduce infighting dirty play between teams neutral zone was created along width football before snap Scoring was also adjusted points awarded field goals were reduced three in points touchdowns were raised six in field was also shortened yards m long but two yard long m end zones were created teams were given four downs instead three advance ball yards m roughing passer penalty was implemented in eligible players were first allowed catch ball anywhere on field in Professional era edit William Pudge Heffelfinger widely regarded as first professional football player team from Indiana Soldiers Sailors Children s Home On November William Pudge Heffelfinger was paid play game Allegheny Athletic Association in match against Pittsburgh Athletic Club This first recorded instance player being paid participate in game American football although many athletic clubs in s offered indirect benefits such as helping players attain employment giving out trophies watches that players could pawn money paying double in expense money Despite these extra benefits game had strict sense amateurism at time direct payment players was frowned upon if not prohibited outright Over time professional play became increasingly common with it came rising salaries unpredictable player movement as well as illegal payment college players were still in school National Football League NFL group professional teams that was originally established in as American Professional Football Association aimed solve these problems This new league s stated goals included an end bidding wars over players prevention use college players abolition practice paying players leave another team By NFL had established itself as America s premier professional football league dominant form football at time was played at collegiate level upstart NFL received boost its legitimacy in however an NFL team Pottsville Maroons defeated team Notre Dame all stars in an exhibition game greater emphasis on passing game helped professional football distinguish itself further from college game during late s Football in general became increasingly popular following NFL Championship game match between Baltimore Colts New York Giants that still referred as Greatest Game Ever Played game overtime victory by Colts was seen by millions television viewers had major impact on popularity sport This along with innovations introduced by new American Football League AFL in early s helped football become most popular sport in United States by mid s rival AFL arose in challenged NFL s dominance AFL began in relative obscurity but eventually thrived with an initial television contract with ABC American Broadcasting Company network AFL s existence forced conservative NFL expand Dallas Minnesota in an attempt destroy new league Meanwhile AFL introduced many new features professional football in United States official time was kept on scoreboard clock rather than on watch in referee s pocket as NFL did optional two point conversions by pass run after touchdowns names on jerseys players several others including expansion role minority players actively recruited by league in contrast NFL AFL also signed several star college players had also been drafted by NFL teams Competition players heated up in AFL New York Jets signed rookie Joe Namath then record contract equivalent million in five year million equivalent billion in NBC television contract followed which helped sustain young league bidding war players ended in NFL owners approached AFL regarding merger two leagues agreed on one that took full effect in This agreement provided common draft that would take place each year it instituted an annual World Championship game be played between champions each league This championship game began play at end season Once merger was completed it was no longer championship game between two leagues reverted NFL championship game which came be known as Super Bowl College football maintained tradition postseason bowl games Each bowl game was associated with particular conference earning spot in bowl game was reward winning conference This arrangement was profitable but it tended prevent two top ranked teams from meeting in true national championship game as they would normally be committed bowl games respective conferences Several systems have been used since determine national champion college football first was Bowl Coalition in place from This was replaced in by Bowl Alliance which gave way in Bowl Championship Series BCS BCS arrangement proved be controversial was replaced in by College Football Playoff CFP Teams positions edit Main article American football positions football game played between two teams players each Playing with more on field punishable by penalty Teams may substitute any number players between downs this platoon system replaced original system which featured limited substitution rules has resulted in teams utilizing specialized offensive defensive special teams units Individual players in football game must be designated with uniform number between NFL teams are required number players by league approved numbering system any exceptions must be approved by Commissioner NCAA NFHS teams are strongly advised number offensive players according league suggested numbering scheme Although sport played almost exclusively by men women are eligible play in high school college professional football No woman has ever played in NFL but women have played in high school college football games In players in Pop Warner Little Scholars youth football were girls around million Americans report playing tackle football are female according Sports Fitness Industry Association Women can also serve as officials Sarah Thomas became NFL s first female official in Offensive unit edit role offensive unit advance football down field with ultimate goal scoring touchdown diagram typical pre snap formation offense red lined up in variation formation while defense blue lined up in defense Both formations are legal offensive team must line up in legal formation before they can snap ball An offensive formation considered illegal if are more than four players in backfield fewer than five players numbered on offensive line Players can line up temporarily in position whose eligibility different from number permits as long as they report change immediately referee then informs defensive team change Neither team s players except center C are allowed line up in cross neutral zone until ball snapped Interior offensive linemen are not allowed move until snap ball quarterback Kiel Baltic Hurricanes under center ready take snap main backfield positions are quarterback QB halfback tailback HB TB fullback FB quarterback leader offense Either quarterback coach calls plays Quarterbacks typically inform rest offense play in huddle before team lines up quarterback lines up behind center take snap then hands ball off throws it runs with it primary role halfback also known as running back tailback carry ball on running plays Halfbacks may also serve as receivers Fullbacks tend be larger than halfbacks function primarily as blockers but they are sometimes used as runners in short yardage situations are seldom used in passing situations offensive line OL consists several players whose primary function block members defensive line from tackling ball carrier on running plays sacking quarterback on passing plays leader offensive line center responsible snapping ball quarterback blocking making sure that other linemen do jobs during play On either side center are guards G while tackles T line up outside guards principal receivers are wide receivers WR tight ends TE Wide receivers line up on near line scrimmage split outside line main goal wide receiver catch passes thrown by quarterback but they may also function as decoys as blockers during running plays Tight ends line up outside tackles function both as receivers as blockers Defensive unit edit Dallas Cowboys defensive players force Houston Texans running back Arian Foster fumble ball role defense prevent offense from scoring by tackling ball carrier by forcing turnovers interceptions fumbles defensive line DL consists defensive ends DE defensive tackles DT Defensive ends line up on ends line while defensive tackles line up inside between defensive ends primary responsibilities defensive ends defensive tackles are stop running plays on outside inside respectively pressure quarterback on passing plays occupy line so that linebackers can break through Cornerback Brent Grimes Hamburg Sea Devils intercepts pass Linebackers line up behind defensive line but in front defensive backfield They are divided into two types middle linebackers MLB outside linebackers OLB Linebackers are defensive leaders call defensive plays diverse roles include defending run pressuring quarterback guarding backs wide receivers tight ends in passing game defensive backfield often called secondary consists cornerbacks CB safeties S Safeties are themselves divided into free safeties FS strong safeties SS Cornerbacks line up outside defensive formation typically opposite receiver be able cover them Safeties line up between cornerbacks but farther back in secondary Safeties are last line defense are responsible stopping deep passing plays as well as running plays Special teams unit edit Kicker Jeff Reed Pittsburgh Steelers executes kickoff special teams unit responsible all kicking plays special teams unit team in control ball tries execute field goal FG attempts punts kickoffs while opposing team s unit will aim block return them Three positions are specific field goal PAT point after touchdown unit placekicker K PK holder H long snapper LS long snapper s job snap football holder will catch position it placekicker not usually holder on kickoffs ball kicked off tee however holder may be used in certain situations such as if wind preventing ball from remaining upright on tee player on receiving team catches ball known as kickoff returner KR positions specific punt plays are punter P long snapper upback gunner long snapper snaps football directly punter then drops kicks it before it hits ground Gunners line up split outside line race down field aiming tackle punt returner PR player catches punt Upbacks line up short distance behind line scrimmage providing additional protection punter Rules edit Main article American football rules Scoring edit player Navy Midshipmen dark jersey scores touchdown while defender from Tulsa Golden Hurricane in white looks on goal line marked by small orange pylon In football winner team that has scored more points at end game are multiple ways score in football game touchdown TD worth six points most valuable scoring play in American football touchdown scored live ball advanced into caught in recovered in opposing team s end zone scoring team then attempts try conversion more commonly known as point s after touchdown PAT which single scoring opportunity PAT most commonly attempted from two three yard line depending on level play If PAT scored by placekick dropkick through goal posts it worth one point typically called extra point If it scored by would normally be touchdown it worth two points typically called two point conversion In general extra point almost always successful while two point conversion much riskier play with higher probability failure accordingly extra point attempts are far more common than two point conversion attempts field goal FG worth three points scored ball placekicked dropkicked through uprights over crossbars defense s goalposts After PAT attempt successful field goal scoring team must kick ball off other team safety scored ball carrier tackled in own end zone Safeties are worth two points which are awarded defense In addition team that conceded safety must kick ball scoring team via free kick Field equipment edit Main article American football field football field as seen from behind one end zone tall yellow goal posts mark ball must pass successful field goal extra point large rectangular area marked with team name end zone Football games are played on rectangular field that measures yards m long yards m wide Lines marked along ends sides field are known as end lines sidelines Goal lines are marked yards m inward from each end line Weighted pylons are placed on inside corner intersections goal lines end lines White markings on field identify distance from end zone Inbound lines hash marks are short parallel lines that mark off yard m increments Yard lines which can run width field are marked every yards m one yard wide line placed at each end field this line marked at center two yard line in professional play at three yard line in college play Numerals that display distance from closest goal line in yards are placed on both sides field every ten yards Goalposts are located at center plane two end lines crossbar these posts feet m above ground with vertical uprights at end crossbar feet inches m apart professional collegiate play feet inches m apart high school play uprights extend vertically feet m on professional fields minimum yards m on college fields minimum feet m on high school fields Goal posts are padded at base orange ribbons are normally placed at tip each upright as indicators wind strength direction football itself an oval ball similar balls used in rugby Australian rules football At all levels play football inflated pounds per square inch kPa weighs ounces g beyond that exact dimensions vary slightly In professional play ball has long axis inches cm long circumference inches cm short circumference inches cm In college high school play ball has long axis inches cm long circumference inches cm short circumference inches cm Duration time stoppages edit Football games last total minutes in professional college play are divided into two halves minutes four quarters minutes High school football games are minutes in length with two halves minutes four quarters minutes two halves are separated by halftime period first third quarters are followed by short break Before game starts referee each team s captain meet at midfield coin toss visiting team can call either heads tails winner toss chooses whether receive kick off ball which goal they wish defend They can defer choice until second half Unless winning team decides defer losing team chooses option winning team did not select receive kick select goal defend begin second half Most teams choose receive defer choosing kick ball start game allows other team choose which goal defend Teams switch goals following first third quarters If down in progress quarter ends play continues until down completed Games last longer than defined length due play stoppages average NFL game lasts slightly over three hours Time in football game measured by game clock An operator responsible starting stopping operating game clock based on direction appropriate official separate play clock used determine if delay game infraction has been committed If play clock expires before ball has been snapped free kicked delay game foul called on offense play clock set seconds after certain administrative stoppages in play seconds play proceeding without such stoppages Advancing ball downs edit Carolina Panthers quarterback Jake Delhomme number in motion throwing forward pass are two main ways offense can advance ball running passing In typical play center passes ball backwards between legs quarterback in process known as snap quarterback then either hands ball off back throws ball runs with it play ends player with ball tackled goes out bounds pass hits ground without player having caught it forward pass can be legally attempted only if passer behind line scrimmage only one forward pass can be attempted per down Like in rugby players can also pass ball backwards at any point during play In NFL down also ends immediately if runner s helmet comes off offense given series four plays known as downs If offense advances ten more yards in four downs they are awarded new set four downs If they fail advance ten yards possession football turned over defense In most situations if offense reaches fourth down they will punt ball other team which forces them begin drive from farther down field if they are in field goal range they might attempt score field goal instead group officials chain crew keeps track both downs distance measurements On television yellow line electronically superimposed on field show first down line viewing audience Kicking edit Green Bay Packers placekicker Mason Crosby attempts field goal by kicking ball from hands holder This standard method score field goals extra points are two categories kicks in football scrimmage kicks which can be executed by offensive team on any down from behind on line scrimmage free kicks free kicks are kickoff which starts first third quarters overtime follows try attempt successful field goal safety kick follows safety On kickoff ball placed at yard line kicking team in professional college play at yard line in high school play ball may be drop kicked place kicked If place kick chosen ball can be placed on ground tee holder may be used in either case On safety kick kicking team kicks ball from own yard line They can punt drop kick place kick ball but tee may not be used in professional play Any member receiving team may catch advance ball ball may be recovered by kicking team once it has gone at least ten yards has touched ground has been touched by any member receiving team three types scrimmage kicks are place kicks drop kicks punts Only place kicks drop kicks can score points place kick standard method used score points pointy shape football makes it difficult reliably drop kick Once ball has been kicked from scrimmage kick it can be advanced by kicking team only if it caught recovered behind line scrimmage If it touched recovered by kicking team beyond this line it becomes dead at spot it was touched kicking team prohibited from interfering with receiver s opportunity catch ball receiving team has option signaling fair catch which prohibits defense from blocking into tackling receiver play ends as soon as ball caught ball may not be advanced Officials fouls edit See also Official American football Chain crew Penalty gridiron football Officials use chains measure first down Here ball just short pole therefore short first down Officials are responsible enforcing game rules monitoring clock All officials carry whistle wear black white striped shirts black hats except referee whose hat white Each carries weighted yellow flag that thrown ground signal that foul has been called An official spots multiple fouls will throw hat as secondary signal seven officials on field are each tasked with different set responsibilities referee positioned behind side offensive backs referee charged with oversight control game authority on score down number any rule interpretations in discussions among other officials referee announces all penalties discusses infraction with offending team s captain monitors illegal hits against quarterback makes requests first down measurements notifies head coach whenever player ejected referee positions themselves passing arm side quarterback In most games referee responsible spotting football prior play from scrimmage umpire positioned in defensive backfield except in NFL umpire positioned lateral referee on opposite side formation umpire watches play along line scrimmage make sure that no more than offensive players are on field before snap that no offensive linemen are illegally downfield on pass plays umpire monitors contact between offensive defensive linemen calls most holding penalties umpire records number timeouts taken winner coin toss game score assists referee in situations involving possession ball close line scrimmage determines whether player equipment legal dries wet balls prior snap if game played in rain back judge positioned deep in defensive backfield behind umpire back judge ensures that defensive team has no more than players on field determines whether catches are legal whether field goal extra point attempts are good whether pass interference violation occurred back judge also responsible play clock time between each play visible play clock not used head linesman down judge positioned on one end line scrimmage head linesman down judge watches any line scrimmage illegal use hands violations assists line judge with illegal shift illegal motion calls head linesman down judge also rules on out bounds calls that happen on side field oversees chain crew marks forward progress runner play has been whistled dead modern down indicator box mounted on pole used mark current line scrimmage number on marker changed using dial side judge positioned twenty yards downfield head linesman side judge mainly duplicates functions field judge On field goal extra point attempts side judge positioned lateral umpire line judge positioned on end line scrimmage opposite head linesman They supervise player substitutions line scrimmage during punts game timing line judge notifies referee time has expired at end quarter notifies head coach home team five minutes remain halftime In NFL line judge also alerts referee two minutes remain in half If clock malfunctions becomes inoperable line judge becomes official timekeeper field judge positioned twenty yards downfield from line judge field judge monitors controls play clock counts number defensive players on field watches offensive pass interference illegal use hands violations by offensive players field judge also makes decisions regarding catches recoveries ball spot player goes out bounds illegal touching fumbled balls that have crossed line scrimmage On field goal extra point attempts field judge stationed under upright opposite back judge center judge an eighth official used only in top level college football center judge stands lateral referee same way umpire does in NFL center judge responsible spotting football after each play has many same responsibilities as referee except announcing penalties Another set officials chain crew are responsible moving chains chains consisting two large sticks with yard long chain between them are used measure first down chain crew stays on sidelines during game but if requested by officials they will briefly bring chains on field measure typical chain crew will have at least three people two members chain crew will hold either two sticks while third will hold down marker down marker large stick with dial on it flipped after each play indicate current down typically moved approximate spot ball chain crew system has been used over years considered be an accurate measure distance rarely subject criticism from either side Safety brain health edit See also Protective equipment in gridiron football Health issues in American football Vince Agnew wearing helmet Shoulder pads thigh pads are visible under his uniform Football full contact sport injuries are relatively common Most injuries occur during training sessions particularly ones that involve contact between players try prevent injuries players are required wear set equipment At minimum players must wear football helmet set shoulder pads but individual leagues may require additional padding such as thigh pads guards knee pads chest protectors mouthguards Most injuries occur in lower extremities particularly in knee but significant number also affect upper extremities most common types injuries are strains sprains bruises fractures dislocations concussions Repeated concussions possibly sub concussive head impacts can increase person s risk in later life CTE chronic traumatic encephalopathy mental health issues such as dementia Parkinson s disease depression Concussions are often caused by helmet helmet upper body contact between opposing players although helmets have prevented more serious injuries such as skull fractures Various programs are aiming reduce concussions by reducing frequency helmet helmet hits USA Football s Heads Up Football program aims reduce concussions in youth football by teaching coaches players about signs concussion proper way wear football equipment ensure it fits proper tackling methods that avoid helmet helmet contact However study in Orthopaedic Journal Sports Medicine found that Heads Up Football was ineffective same study noted that more extensive reforms implemented by Pop Warner Little Scholars its member teams were effective in significantly reducing concussion rates study performed by VA Boston Healthcare System Boston University School Medicine found that tackle football before age was correlated with earlier onset symptoms CTE but not with symptom severity More specifically each year player played tackle football under age predicted earlier onset cognitive behavioral mood problems by an average two half years Leagues tournaments edit National Football League NFL National Collegiate Athletic Association NCAA are most popular football leagues in United States National Football League was founded in has since become largest most popular sport in United States NFL has highest average attendance any sporting league in world with an average attendance during NFL season NFL championship game called Super Bowl among biggest events in club sports worldwide It played between champions National Football Conference NFC American Football Conference AFC its winner awarded Vince Lombardi Trophy high school football game during first quarter College football third most popular sport in United States behind professional baseball professional football NCAA largest collegiate organization divided into three Divisions Division Division II Division III Division football further divided into two subdivisions Football Bowl Subdivision FBS Football Championship Subdivision FCS champions each level play are determined through NCAA sanctioned playoff systems while champion Division FBS was historically determined by various polls ranking systems subdivision adopted four team playoff system in High school football most popular sport in United States played by boys over million boys participated in sport from according survey by National Federation State High School Associations NFHS NFHS largest organization high school football with member associations in all states as well as District Columbia USA Football governing body youth amateur football Pop Warner Little Scholars largest organization youth football Rival professional leagues edit Several professional football leagues have been formed as rival leagues NFL most successful was American Football League AFL which existed from AFL became significant rival in before signing five year US million television deal with NBC AFL teams began signing NFL players contracts league s popularity grew challenge that NFL two leagues merged in season all AFL teams joined NFL An earlier league All America Football Conference AAFC was in play from After it had dissolved two AAFC teams Cleveland Browns San Francisco ers became members NFL another member Baltimore Colts joined league but folded after just year in NFL Other attempts start rival leagues have been far less successful World Football League WFL played two seasons in but faced such severe monetary issues it could not pay its players In its second final season WFL attempted establish stable credit rating but league disbanded before season could be completed United States Football League USFL operated three seasons from but collapsed due poor business decisions monetary problems subsequent US billion antitrust lawsuit against NFL was successful in court but league was awarded only in damages which was automatically tripled under antitrust law XFL was created in by Vince McMahon lasted only one season Despite television contracts with NBC UPN high expectations XFL suffered from poor television ratings low quality play United Football League UFL began in but folded after suspending its season due financial issues International play edit Players with one youth divisions Borregos Salvajes football program Monterrey Institute Technology Higher Education Mexico City American football leagues exist throughout world but game has yet achieve international success popularity baseball basketball It not an Olympic sport but it was demonstration sport at Summer Olympics At international level Canada Mexico Japan are considered be second tier while Austria Germany France would rank among third tier These countries rank far below United States which dominant at international level NFL Europa developmental league NFL operated from then from At time its closure NFL Europa had five teams based in Germany one in Netherlands In Germany German Football League GFL has teams has operated over seasons with league s championship game German Bowl closing out each season league operates in promotion relegation structure with German Football League GFL which also has teams BIG European Football League functions as continental championship Europe competition contested between top six European teams American football federations are present in Africa Americas Asia Europe Oceania total national football federations exist as July International Federation American Football IFAF an international governing body composed continental federations runs tournaments such as IFAF World Championship IFAF Women s World Championship IFAF U World Championship Flag Football World Championship IFAF also organizes annual International Bowl game IFAF has received provisional recognition from International Olympic Committee IOC Several major obstacles hinder IFAF goal achieving status as an Olympic sport These include predominant participation men in international play short three week Olympic schedule Large team sizes are an additional difficulty due Olympics set limit athletes coaches American football also has an issue with lack global visibility Nigel Melville CEO USA Rugby noted that American football recognized globally as sport but it s not played globally solve these concerns major effort has been put into promoting flag football modified version American football at international level Popularity cultural impact edit United States edit Main article American football in United States Baseball still called national pastime but football by far more popular sport in American society according ESPN com s Sean McAdam In poll conducted by Harris Interactive professional football ranked as most popular sport college football ranked third behind only professional football baseball participants ranked some form game as favorite sport Professional football has ranked as most popular sport in poll since it surpassed baseball first time Professional football most popular among those live in eastern United States rural areas while college football most popular in southern United States among people with graduate post graduate degrees Football also most played sport by high school college athletes in United States In study NCAA estimated were around million high school football players nearly college football players in United States in comparison second most played sport basketball had around million participants in high school in college Super Bowl most popular single day sporting event in United States among biggest club sporting events in world in terms TV viewership NFL makes approximately billion annually Super Bowl games account seven top eight most watched broadcasts in American history Super Bowl XLIX played on February was watched by record million Americans American football also plays significant role in American culture day on which Super Bowl held considered de facto national holiday in parts country like Texas sport has been compared religion Football also linked other holidays New Year s Day traditionally date several college football bowl games including Rose Bowl However if New Year s Day on Sunday bowl games are moved another date so as not conflict with typical NFL Sunday schedule Thanksgiving football an American tradition hosting many high school college professional games Steve Deace USA Today wrote that Americans are passionate about football it embodies everything we love about American exceptionalism Merit rewarded not punished Masculinity celebrated not feminized People various beliefs backgrounds melting pot if will must unify common goal team be successful Implicit rules such as playing through pain sacrificing better team are promoted in football culture safety sport has also sparked national controversy in American popular culture It often received as overly aggressive defamiliarized in popular culture film Concussion aimed shed light on sport s safety specifically in NFL by having Will Smith portray Dr Bennet Omalu neuropathologist was first discover publish findings chronic traumatic encephalopathy CTE Other countries edit In Canada game has significant following According poll respondents said they followed NFL very closely fairly closely making it third most followed league behind National Hockey League NHL Canadian Football League CFL American football also has long history in Mexico which was introduced sport in It was second most popular sport in Mexico in s with game being particularly popular in colleges Los Angeles Times notes NFL claims over million fans in Mexico which places country third behind US Canada American football played in Mexico both professionally as part college sports system professional league Liga de F tbol Americano Profesional LFA was founded in Opening ceremony NFL International Series at London s Wembley Stadium Japan was introduced sport in by Paul Rusch teacher Christian missionary helped establish football teams at three universities in Tokyo Play was halted during World War II but sport began growing in popularity again after war As update are more than high school football teams in Japan with over participants over teams play in Kantoh Collegiate Football Association KCFA college champion plays champion X League semi professional league teams are financed by corporations in Rice Bowl determine Japan s national champion Europe major target expansion game by football organizers In United Kingdom in s sport was popular with Super Bowl being watched by over four million people about out every Britons Its popularity faded during s coinciding with establishment Premier League top level English football league system According BBC America social stigma surrounding American football in UK with many Brits feeling sport has no right call itself football due lack emphasis on kicking Nonetheless sport has retained following in United Kingdom NFL operates media network in country since has hosted NFL International Series in London Super Bowl viewership has also rebounded with over million Britons watching Super Bowl XLVI sport played in European countries like Switzerland which has American football clubs in every major city Germany sport has around registered amateur players In Brazil football growing sport It was generally unknown until s small group players began playing on Copacabana Beach in Rio de Janeiro sport grew gradually with amateur players registering within years Games were played on beach with modified rules without traditional football equipment due its lack availability in Brazil Eventually tournament Carioca championship was founded with championship Carioca Bowl played determine league champion country saw its first full pad game football in October According Rio Times sport one fastest growing sports in Brazil almost as commonly played as soccer on beaches Copacabana Botafogo Football in Brazil governed by Confedera o Brasileira de Futebol Americano CBFA which had over registered players as November sport s increase in popularity has been attributed games aired on ESPN which began airing in Brazil in with Portuguese commentary popularity easy accessibility non contact versions sport in Brazil has led rise in participation by female players According ESPN American football audience in Brazil increased between network along with Esporte Interativo airs games on cable television Football often associated in Brazil as being sport supermodel Gisele B ndchen s husband Tom Brady NFL has expressed interest in having games in country Super Bowl has become widely watched event in Brazil at bars movie theaters Variations related sports edit See also Canadian football Arena football Flag football Men playing game flag football Canadian football predominant form football in Canada closely related American football both sports developed from rugby are considered be chief variants gridiron football Although both games share similar set rules are several key rule differences example in Canadian football field measures by yards by m including two yard end zones distance between goal lines yards teams have three downs instead four are twelve players on each side instead eleven fair catches are not allowed rouge worth single point scored if offensive team kicks ball out defense s end zone Canadian Football League CFL major Canadian league second most popular sporting league in Canada behind National Hockey League NFL CFL had formal working relationship from CFL has strategic partnership with two American football leagues German Football League GFL Liga du Futbol Americano Professional LFA major variant football arena football played by Arena Football League AFL Arena football has eight player teams uses an indoor field yards m in length excluding end zones yards m wide Punting illegal kickoffs are attempted from goal line Large overhead nets deflect forward passes kicks that hit them deflected kicks are live balls that may be recovered by either team Below Arena Football League are New York Times writer Mike Tanier described as most minor minor leagues indoor football leagues Like in arena football teams in indoor football leagues play in arenas but games are only attended by small number fans most players are semi professional athletes Indoor football leagues are unstable with franchises regularly moving from one league another merging with other teams teams entire leagues dissolving completely Indoor Football League National Arena League Champions Indoor Football American Arena League are examples prominent indoor leagues that were active as are several non contact variants football like flag football In flag football ballcarrier not tackled instead defenders aim pull flag tied around waist Another variant touch football simply requires ballcarrier be touched be considered downed Depending on rules used game touch football may require player be touched with either one two hands be considered down See also edit American football portal American football strategy College football Comparison American football rugby union Comparison American football rugby league Concussions in American football Fantasy football American Glossary American football List American football players List American football stadiums by capacity List leagues American Canadian football Pro Football Hall Fame Steroid use in American football Notes edit terms gridiron football gridiron are sometimes used as synonyms American football are also sometimes used in broader sense that includes Canadian football as well Footnotes edit b Florio Mike July Football
